author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Turkish Airlines expand network in Saudi Arabia - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Turkish Airlines expand network in Saudi Arabia Published on : Monday, July 13, 2015
While ranking among the world’s major airline companies with its impressive growth figures and already having the world’s 4th largest flight network by flying to 276 destinations in 110 countries, Turkish Airlines continues to grow by offering new flight opportunities to its passengers.
With existing services to Amsterdam, Baku, Berlin, Brussels, Dusseldorf, Northern Cyprus, Frankfurt, Kiev, Kuwait, London, Milano, Munchen, Paris, Tbilisi, Tehran, Tel Aviv, Vienna, Rome, Stuttgart, Köln (Cologne) and Barcelona, Turkish Airlines now adds flights to Dammam as its 22th flight destination operated from/to Sabiha Gökçen International Airport, which will offer a great travel alternative not only for those who want to reach Istanbul, but also for Saudi Arabian travelers who wish to reach destinations beyond, both in Turkey and abroad.
Beginning from today, Dammam flights from/to Sabiha Gökçen International Airport will be operated 7 times per week in both directions.
